FuncDef: The refresh bgp evpn command configures soft reset for BGP EVPN connections. The refresh bgp evpn command configures soft reset for BGP EVPN connections. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: refresh bgp instance <bgpName> evpn <peer-address> { import | export }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays BGP routes of a specified BGP multi-instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. If spaces are used, the string must be enclosed in double quotation marks (" ").

ExtraInfo: If the peer supports route-refresh, you can run the refresh bgp evpn command to soft reset the BGP EVPN connection. BGP EVPN soft reset can refresh the EVPN routing table and apply new filtering policies without tearing down the BGP connection.
